body:
The Mobile wiki currently says:

> Prior to Xcode 7, you need to obtain a signing identity and download provisioning profiles in order to continue.

Xcode 7 was released today. I've downloaded it and ran into the same problem:

```
$ gomobile build -target=ios golang.org/x/mobile/example/basic
gomobile: xcrun xcodebuild -configuration Release -project /var/folders/tw/kgz4v2kn4n7d7ryg5k_z3dk40000gn/T/gomobile-work-121840117/main.xcodeproj failed: exit status 65
=== BUILD TARGET main OF PROJECT main WITH CONFIGURATION Release ===

Check dependencies
Code Sign error: No code signing identities found: No valid signing identities (i.e. certificate and private key pair) were found.

** BUILD FAILED **


The following build commands failed:
	Check dependencies
(1 failure)
```

I went to Xcode, Preferences, Accounts, and added my Apple ID. Still same issue.

Then I went to View Details and pressed Create action button next to "iOS Development" of signing identities:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1924134/9928875/e8fb9960-5cdd-11e5-85b7-3e8e1fa83a0e.png)

After that, the error became different:

```
$ gomobile build -target=ios golang.org/x/mobile/example/basic
gomobile: xcrun xcodebuild -configuration Release -project /var/folders/tw/kgz4v2kn4n7d7ryg5k_z3dk40000gn/T/gomobile-work-329279846/main.xcodeproj failed: exit status 65
=== BUILD TARGET main OF PROJECT main WITH CONFIGURATION Release ===

Check dependencies
Code Sign error: No provisioning profiles found: No nonâ€“expired provisioning profiles were found.

** BUILD FAILED **


The following build commands failed:
	Check dependencies
(1 failure)
```

It seems that even with Xcode 7, you still need a signing identity and provisioning profiles? Or am I missing/doing something wrong? Note, I haven't plugged in a physical iOS device yet; I was gonna try the .app bundle on simulator first.
